text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the English court can allow the tribunal to revoke its injunction under Section 44(6) of the Arbitration Act 1996. The candidate answer discusses Section 44(2)(e) (ancillary jurisdiction to grant relief in support of arbitration) but makes no mention of Section 44(6), which deals with the court's power to revoke or vary interim relief previously granted by the court in support of the arbitration, often upon application by the tribunal or a party.
